definition: throat
throat/voice
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
erhua variant of 嗓子眼[sang3 zi5 yan3]

sentences.english: My heart stopped in my throat as it happened.
sentences.chinese: 它发生时，我的心激动地悬在了嗓子眼。

sentences.english: The thickness still came in his throat .
sentences.chinese: 他嗓子眼儿里还是阵阵发紧。

sentences.english: My heart was in my mouth when I reached the top of the  roller coaster.
sentences.chinese: 过山车到达最高点的时候，我的心都提到嗓子眼儿了。

sentences.english: When you are frightened or concerned, your "heart is in your mouth."
sentences.chinese: 当你害怕或担心，你“心悬到嗓子眼。”

sentences.english: These two days, I have had a fever and a throatache.
sentences.chinese: 我这两天一直发烧，而且嗓子眼疼。

sentences.english: I had my heart in my mouth when I went to ask the boss for more money.
sentences.chinese: 我去向老板再要一些钱时心跳到了嗓子眼儿里。

sentences.english: Last night, I dreamed about being chased by an angry dog. I really had my heart in my mouth.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我梦到被一条疯狗追，吓得我心都提到嗓子眼了。

sentences.english: My heart was in my mouth when I reached the top of the roller coaster.
sentences.chinese: 过山车到达最高点的时候，我的心都提到嗓子眼儿了。

sentences.english: Her heart hammered in her throat as she felt for the key.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手去摸油门钥匙，心都跳到嗓子眼上来了。

sentences.english: But my first crossing of the Grand Canal is a heart-in-mouth moment.
sentences.chinese: 但我第一次穿过大运河时，紧张得心脏提到了嗓子眼。

sentences.english: The thickness still came in his throat.
sentences.chinese: 他嗓子眼儿里还是阵阵发紧。

definition: erhua variant of 嗓子眼[sang3 zi5 yan3]
thumping sound (onom.)/to be eager and anxious (to do sth)/faithful and upright
throat/larynx
at sixes and sevens/perturbed state of mind/in a mess
thoracic cavity/intonation/accent
to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
to get angry/to burn with rage
throat/larynx
erhua variant of 差點|差点[cha4 dian3]
felt a chill (in one's heart)/(one's heart) sank
throat/voice/CL:把[ba3]
restless with anxiety/unbearably hot and anxious
to shiver/to tremble
(onom.) beating of the heart/pitapat/pulsation of a machine
to shiver
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
